The role of the IT Service Desk Team Leader is to take responsibility for the day to day management of the service and technical team and for the smooth running of the technical support service. This includes ensuring all processes, policies and procedures are continually followed, updated and enhanced upon day-to-day and as the business continues to grow and develop. The Technical Team Leader is responsible for the line management of the entire Technical and Service Team.

Responsibility and duties

Provide exceptional and first-class remote, on site, and telephone based technical support at all times, building a rapport with existing and potential clients and ensure this is reflected among the support team.

Create policies, procedures and processes and ensuring those policies, procedures and processes are followed by the team and that any necessary or recommended changes and any significant breaches are investigated and brought to the attention of the SMT.

Management of all technical aspects of installations and delivering support.

Management of technical queries from clients and ensuring all such queries and handled in line with Service Level Agreements − progressing customer complaints if required and providing a point for complaint escalation.

Management of the office environment so it is kept clean, well maintained and is consistent with brand values.

Manage all supporting administration and documentation ensuring it is accurate and timely. Ensuring all client system information and technical notes are logged onto the ticketing system along with also technician reports for on-site works.

Ensure ownership is taken of client technical issues and that these are seen through to completion.

Build and develop upon existing SLA’s and KPI’s within the business to further enhance the support and solutions offering of the company and enhance existing reports, live reporting, metrics and KPIs.

The TTL is involved in the vision of the business and should put forward suggestions at all times.

Ensure relevant Service Level Agreements (SLAs) are in place, managed, monitored and reported on and communicated to customers, ensuring that all tickets are up-to-date, and SLAs are met.

Implement methodologies to improve call resolution, manage customer perceptions, and build strong internal relationships.

Coordinate the identification and resolution of service incidents and problems and where required escalate to and coordinate resolution with third party vendors.

Allocation and prioritisation of staff, skills and resources to ensure a professional solution based service to customers.

Design and enforce support request handling, escalation policies and procedures.

To advise clients on the best technology investments and to make suggestions as such; to work closely with the Account Management team.

On-going review of technical systems and developments to maintain expert technical knowledge that will facilitate the identification and implementation of best practices to enhance and build a robust and effective operation to assist the company maintain our competitive advantage.

Contribute to the change management process; in particular represent the interests of the customer when assessing risk and impact. Help to identify, specify and deliver changes required to clients. Monitor changes completed and update documentation as required.

TRULY FIBRE, TRULY FAST

We're expanding our team as we transform broadband in Kent and beyond. If you'd like to join us on our

exciting journey, we'd love to hear from you. We are building our own fibre optic networks to homes and

businesses using Fibre to the Premises (FTTP) technology – this means we can offer our customers the

highest speed and highest quality broadband services in the country – guaranteed! The Trooli networks

are modern, future-proof and fit for the digital age.

THE ROLE

We’re a small company with a very exciting future. We can offer a unique opportunity to a dynamic
individual who can provide excellent in-life care for our customers. You will work as part of a rapidly
growing team, managing customer service requests. You will also assist customers by maintaining and
restoring their broadband service in a timely manner.

Responsibilities

• Responding to customers when service issues are detected

• Manage successful communication with customers through various means; phone, e-mail and webchat.

• Problem diagnosis and fault recognition.

• Owning the customer resolution life cycle.

• Logging and keeping records of customer services issues and solutions in the helpdesk ticket system.

• Communicating with second- and third-line support and escalate service issues to the appropriate level
for swift resolution.

• Performing pro-active network health activities

• Work collaboratively with field engineers who conduct site visits.

• You will be expected to have a good level of IT literacy and be able to learn new software systems
quickly.

• Use remote access software to assist our customers and fix network issues

• Updating self-help documents so customers and colleagues can fix problems themselves.

• Confidently liaise with third party telecommunication providers to achieve a swift and satisfactory outcome
for our customers.

• A willingness to develop a breadth of knowledge across the company and support where required.

Your experience

You will have at least one years’ experience in a similar service desk role, preferably gained within the

telecommunications industry.

Experience in a technical support and assurance environment would be highly desirable, you must also

be able to demonstrate high levels of customer service and a willingness to proactively resolve customers

technical issues.

Your skills and personal attributes

• You will demonstrate high levels of customer service

• You must possess exceptional communication skills

• Resilient mindset with focus on customer satisfaction beyond expectations.

• Ability to collaborate with internal and external stakeholders

• Strong IT literacy, analytical ability and logical thinking are a must.

• A collaborative and innovative approach to service delivery and problem solving.

• You must have a willingness to learn and grasp new skills quickly and have an interest in
technology.

• A working knowledge of routers, broadband and phone lines.

• Candidates must have a GCSE pass or equivalent in maths and English.

• Networking engineering qualifications would be desirable.

Your personal benefits

• 25 days paid holiday, plus bank holidays

• Pension

• Free parking

• Friendly working environment

• Free hot drinks

• Career progression

Our values

• Integrity: be transparent and honest with our customers and with each other.

• Passion: be excited about what we do.

• Develop: Invest in each individual.

• Continual improvement: Work smarter, not harder.

• Proactive: take responsibility.

• Teamwork: support and collaboration.

• Quality: we do what we do well.

We are looking for highly motivated people that are excited by the prospect of a new challenge. If you

think you are the person we are looking for, please send your CV to hr@trooli.com prior to the closing

date.

Through our commitment to industry-leading technology and creative problem-solving, we are confident that Wayfair will be home to the most rewarding work of your career. No matter who you are, Wayfair is a place you can call home. We value and rely on the collective voices of our employees, customers, community, and suppliers to help guide us as we build a better Wayfair and world for all. Every voice, every perspective matters. Thats why were proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, colour, ethnicity, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship status, marital status, disability, gender identity, gender expression, veteran status, or genetic information.

Job Description:

Network / IT Support Engineer with Help desk, Server, Desktop, Office 365 and Exchange experience required to join our team of 30+ IT support engineers, based in Canterbury. You will be joining a dedicated team of professionals that pride themselves on training and development and ensuring that our clients IT systems are operating to maximum potential. You will be part of a team working in-house and onsite when required, providing general and focused I.T. services. To engage in problem investigation/resolutions and ensure their satisfactory conclusion quickly and effectively.

Soft Skills

Excellent communication skills (specifically verbal)
Professional Attitude
Be forthcoming and have a ‘can do’ attitude
Have a good understanding of impact and urgency
Ability to work on own initiative and manage own workload
Provide 2nd Line support to our clients both onsite and offsite
Act as a point of escalation for the 1st Line team
Proactively help resolve tickets and if required assist the 3rd line team with new projects or ‘on-boards’

Good understanding of Networking infrastructure (LAN/vLAN/WAN)
Good knowledge of routers/firewalls
Good knowledge of switches
Wide understanding of all technologies and be comfortable troubleshooting

Job Title: Service Desk Analyst / IT Support Engineer
Job Description:
As part of our continued growth we are looking to expand our Service Desk team in Warwick; we are looking for technical Service Desk analysts with excellent customer services skills, the right technical aptitude and a desire to continue to deliver the outstanding service and support that our customers have come to expect.

The Role

As part of a small but growing Service Desk team you will support our customers and their end-users by providing general advice and guidance as well as working on Incidents and Service Request to defined SLAs. Depending on your skills and experience you will undertake a range of 1st and 2nd line activities (and a range of other ITIL aligned duties) as part of the team, including…Answering telephone calls, monitoring emails and logging tickets to agreed SLAs
Providing end-user support and assistance for typical desktop, office and other end-user computing tasks
Completing incidents, service requests and other defined activities including performing proactive checks, basic event triage and resolving subsequent issues within agreed parameters, handing-off to other Resolve Groups and third parties when needed
Providing lifecycle support and keeping users informed of progress at all times
You may on occasion be required to work on customer sites
The role requires excellent customer service skills and an ability to communicate with customers at all levels, along with patience, understanding and the ability to proactively take responsibility for end-user’s problems.

What you’ll need to succeed

You will be a confident, pro-active self-motivated person, who is experienced working under pressure in a fast-paced environment. You will be able to follow processes and procedures correctly with minimum oversight, you will work independently as well as part of a multi-skilled team and you must be prepared to work differing shift patterns including occasional evenings and weekends. You will ideally be experienced in dealing with technical hardware and software incidents. The ideal candidate will be motivated to take advantage of internal training and support the business in maintaining our Microsoft Gold Partnership status by keeping up-to-date with the latest Microsoft certifications.

The position will involve the following areas of responsibility, you will:

• Be the first point of contact and you will be responsible for the triage of Service Desk calls; you will properly categorise and prioritise these calls and escalate if required.
• Be responsible for responding and logging Service Desk tickets that are submitted through telephone, email or via our web portal.
• Be responsible for responding to and resolving customers support calls within contracted SLAs.
• Take ownership of queries raised, ensuring a proactive response is provided through efficient and effective communication with internal and external stakeholders within required service levels.
• Maintain accurate audit trails of contact and outcomes and to support with the
maintenance of appropriate departmental MI and record keeping using the systems
provided.
• Identify trends to support with the effective management of root cause analysis and risk
mitigation.
• Effectively communicate with customers and end-users.
• Utilise appropriate questioning and listening skills to identify and offer appropriate solutions.
• Successfully establish and maintain partnerships with others through effective interpersonal skills.
• Troubleshoot, diagnose and rectifying technical problems and queries following first-line-fix criteria and where possible resolving at first contact.
• Set up new user accounts & profiles, set up and configuring new laptops and desktops to agreed standards and specific builds.
• Install authorised software on laptops and desktops.
• Manage third party vendors and suppliers, logging and escalating calls with third parties where required, ensuring communication back to the customer.

Ideal Experience

We are looking for people that can demonstrate the required technical and customer services skills therefore the following experience is advantageous:• Working within a managed service provider environment
• Knowledge of MS Office 365 applications
• Experience in Autotask/AEM or another ITSM tool (Service Centre/Remedy)
• Experience with Windows 7, 8 & 10, Windows Server 2008 / 2012, 2016, Mac OSX
• Active Directory basics i.e. password reset
• Understanding of workstation hardware, including installing PCs and printers.
• Mobile device configuration
• Basic VPN experience
• Basic networking principles TCP/IP
• RDP or remote access tool experience
• Basic understanding of setting up and maintaining users, and managing permissions.
• Basic understanding of anti-virus software/anti-spam solutions
• Troubleshooting and assisting with internet related problems

Technical Certifications Desirable:

• NVQ IT
• GNVQ IT
• City and Guilds
• COMPTIA+ (Assures the below)
• MS Certificate(s)
• GCSE A-C
• A Level A-C

How To Apply

If this sounds of interest, please complete the form below or send an updated CV and cover letter to hello@zenzero.co.uk

Please note: this role is based in our Warwick office therefore we are looking for candidates that are able to easily commute and commit to our shift and work patterns. Whilst we try and provide feedback, unfortunately we are unable to respond individually to each applicant. If you do not hear from us within 14 days of submitting your details, you may assume you have not been selected on this occasion. We have an approved supplier process so no recruitment agencies please.

Job Title: Junior IT Support Engineer - Cyber Security
Job Description:
Junior IT Support Engineer (Graduate) *Remote Interview WfH*. Are you a tenacious and driven STEM subject graduate? You could be joining one of the world's most advanced Cyber Security technology companies, continually learning and progressing your career in a supportive, diverse, tech driven environment.

Typically you'll be responding to requests for product support, explaining features of the software to help customers optimise their use of the platform, ensure customer deployments are running efficiently and liaise between the customer and internal development teams when issues arise.

You'll be supported to reach your full potential as a Junior IT Support Engineer and will gain an indepth knowledge of the suite of AI based Cyber Security products that are leading the way with cutting edge technology that is constantly evolving.

Driven by technology the company can offer a remote interview / onboarding process and work from home during the current social distancing measures with a gradual return to their custom built offices, likely to be in the new year. You'll be based in Cambridge (about a 20 minute walk from the local station and with regular shuttle bus; there's also parking available); there's a range of perks including free top quality catered lunch every Friday, social activities ranging from sports to board game nights; breakout areas and solo pods.

You're degree educated, having achieved a 2.1 or above in a STEM discipline
You have a genuine enthusiasm and drive to work in technical support and a keen interest in Cyber Security
You are familiar with Data and Data Analytics tools and have a good basic knowledge of networking protocols
You're collaborative and outgoing with customer service skills and are keen to learn and progress your career in a technical environment
As a Junior IT Support Engineer you will earn a competitive salary (to £35k) plus benefits.

Apply now or call to find out more about this Junior IT Support Engineer (Graduate / Junior) opportunity.

Job Type: Full-time

You dont need to go to university to kickstart your career!

By choosing Primary Goal as your training provider not only will you be learning whilst you're earning you will also be keeping up to date with the latest technology. At the same time, you will gain amazing industry recognised Microsoft qualifications without the need of going to college: -
Microsoft MTA Server Fundamentals

BCS Business Processes
We are recruiting on behalf of Thomas Deacon Education Trust where you will gain valuable experience and a Level 3 Infrastructure Technician qualification. We pride ourselves on the support we give our apprentices, you wont be left on your own to figure things out, we will support you throughout your apprenticeship journey together with your employer!

Who youll be working for:

The Thomas Deacon Education Trust (TDET) is a Multi-Academy Trust that unites and empowers like-minded schools to achieve the very best for their students and communities.

What you will be doing:

Increase the use of technology in Academies by ensuring all hardware devices are well maintained and by ensuring staff, pupils, parents and occasional visitors are supported in the use of technology to enhance learning.

The apprentice will be based full time on-site, initially responsible for Level 1 [progressing with experience to Level 2] IT issues that arise, supported by Primary Goal and the designated IT company working with the school.

In co-operation with teachers, they will also support the teaching of computing and the embedding of technology across the curriculum by preparing relevant materials and working alongside pupils, parents and teachers. This may also involve running extra-curricular activities such as coding clubs, mini-geek squad, Minecraft club and Lego club.

Being part of the Primary Goal community will give apprentices access to a range of other apprentices (with varying levels of experience) who can share good practice and offer suggestions and support. Our apprentices love being able to help each other!

Apprentices will have access to specialist industry partners for technology in the curriculum, on hand to provide advice and support, access to resources and themed training days.

The Primary Goal portal is an online dashboard that will provide apprentices with a knowledge base to access information and technical guidance, as well as links to the helpdesk to speak to technicians who can give real-time advice and support.

As part of this opportunity, you will learn:
Working knowledge of a range of cabling and connectivity, the various types of antennas and wireless systems and IT test equipment
Understanding of maintenance processes and applies them in working practices
Understand and applies the basic elements and architecture of computer systems
Understands where to apply the relevant numerical skills e.g. Binary
Understands the relevant networking skills necessary to maintain a secure network
Understands the similarities, differences and benefits of the current Operating Systems available
Understands how to operate remotely and how to deploy and securely integrate mobile devices
Understanding and working knowledge of Cloud and Cloud Services
Understands the importance of disaster recovery and how a disaster recovery plan works and their role within it
Understands the similarities and differences between a range of coding and logic
Understands and complies with business processes
Working knowledge of business IT skills relevant to the organisation
The training you'll be provided with:

As a Primary Goal apprentice, you will have access to:
Comprehensive pre-apprenticeship induction programme (including health and safety and technical specifics)
Level 3 Infrastructure Technician apprenticeship standard (Networking and Architecture, Mobile and Operating Systems & Security, Cloud Services, Coding and Logic, Business Processes)
e-learning training materials
Specialist vendor and technical certificates
Access to practice labs to develop technical competency
Knowledge Base
Monthly assessor visits and competency checks
Support desk (technical and pastoral)
Personal Learning and Thinking Skills and Key Skills development
Employment Rights and Responsibilities module
Being part of the Primary Goal community will give apprentices access to a range of other apprentices (with varying levels of experience) who can share good practice and offer suggestions and support. Our apprentices love being able to help each other!

Apprentices will have access to specialist industry partners for technology on hand to provide advice and support, access to resources and themed training days.

The Primary Goal portal is an online dashboard that will provide apprentices with a knowledge base to access information and technical guidance, as well as links to the helpdesk to speak to technicians who can give real-time advice and support.

Successful apprentice will work towards the Level 3 Infrastructure Technician apprenticeship standard including MTA Network Fundamentals, MTA Mobility and Devices Fundamentals, MTA Cloud Fundamentals, MTA Software Development and BCS Business Processes.

What we are looking for:
True passion for new and emerging technology. Is enthusiastic about digital developments and has an active interest in IT keeps up to date with current technology and trends
Confidence when using a range of hardware, software and technical devices
Experience of Microsoft Office applications, including Word and Excel
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills. Able to work in a team and deliver good customer care and communicate clearly with others
Able to demonstrate an aptitude for the skills taught in the Apprenticeship (for example through work experience, qualifications or references)
What your working week will look like:

37 hours per week, specific hours to be determined prior to appointment

Weekly Wage/Hourly Rate:

£4.15 per hour / £8,092.50 annual salary for the first 12 months, followed by National Minimum Wage for the final 3 months.

Expected Duration:

18 months

Start Date:

Immediate start

Desired Qualifications:

We require someone who is educated to GCSE standard English and Maths grade 4 (or above), or functional skills level 2 in English and Maths.

Where a Primary Goal apprenticeship can take you:
This is a great opportunity for you to develop skills that will enhance your career in IT.
With a Primary Goal apprenticeship, you will gain the knowledge to be able to move into a technical or curriculum-focused role. The opportunities are immense!
We also offer a progressive step in some cases, onto our level 4 network engineer apprenticeship programme!
So, what are you waiting for? Apply today, because tomorrow is your future!
PLEASE NOTE that we will require a copy of your personal CV.

Disability Confident: Primary Goal is committed to be a Disability Confident Training Provider, and as such will make reasonable adjustments required for interview. Please discuss any requirements which you may have with the Recruitment Team.

Job Title: 2nd Line IT Support Engineer at ADM
Job Description:
Network / IT Support Engineer with Help desk, Server, Desktop, Office 365 and Exchange experience required to join our team of 30+ IT support engineers, based in Canterbury. You will be joining a dedicated team of professionals that pride themselves on training and development and ensuring that our clients IT systems are operating to maximum potential. Job Description:
Reports to: Head of IT
Salary: £25,000 - £30,000 DOE
Hours: 40 hours per week (Monday to Friday)
Location: Bournemouth

Protect Line: Where Innovation meets Insurance

Our Bournemouth office is home to THE technology HUB for Protect Line and YOU have the ability to BE the difference. Innovation is the I in Insurance and we are committed to investing in our future innovators, disruptors and tech ambassadors.

Having already broken the mould in the Broker world through the design and implementation of our in house software, we have demonstrated that we will not be defined by what already exists but have the courage and attitude to create a new world.

As a member of the Technology squad you will dive head-first into creating innovative solutions that advance businesses and careers. Youll join an inspiring and curious team of technologists dedicated to improving the design, analytics, development, coding, testing and application programming that goes into creating high quality software and new products.

Reporting to our Head of IT - we are looking to appoint an experienced IT Support Technician who has a broad skill set and an awesome attitude. Your quick thinking, innovative and proactive approach will ensure that issues are resolved seamlessly.

You will share responsibilities of administering different systems and technologies including but not limited to Active Directory, Office 365, our CRM and phone systems so you need to be familiar with these already. The BAU will be to Administer and provision users, maintain high standards and SLAs throughout all responsibilities and log all incidents that our raised via the help desk.

You will be unafraid and curious enough to handle undertaking a variety of IT Projects, whilst also being given the autonomy to challenge the status quo. If you have an idea that you think will create a difference, you will have the forum to share it.
In return we will provide you with an inspiring work environment. The Technology Hub sits within the main HQ but is very much its own engine. We have created a Hub that allows us to be creative, innovative and have fun!

What do we need from you?
Strong experience working within an IT function
Have an exceptional understanding of Microsoft Windows 10 and Active Directory
Comfortable working with Linux based systems
Experience offering 2nd and/or 3rd line support
Strong communication with the ability to articulate IT subjects to non-technical users in a clear relatable way
Knowledge of network and VoIP systems would be desirable
Have a strong appreciation for security, best practices and maintenance
A desire to constantly learn new systems and technology
Strong organisational skills with the ability to manage workload and prioritise
Whilst we would love to be able to respond to every application we receive, it isnt always possible due to the high volume we receive each day. We are also experiencing a higher than normal volume meaning our usual response time of 3-5 days is not always met. If you have not heard from us within 7 working days, please assume that your application has not been successful. If your application is not successful, your details will not be retained unless you specifically request us to do so.

Company Overview


At Motorola Solutions, we create technologies our customers refer to as their lifeline. Our technology platforms in communications, software, video and services help our customers work safely and more efficiently. Whether it’s helping firefighters see through smoke, enabling police officers to see around street corners, or reliably keeping the lights on in homes and businesses around the world, our work supports those who put their lives on the line to keep us safe. Bring your passion, potential and talents to Motorola Solutions, and help us usher in a new era in public safety and security.


Department Overview
The IT Support Engineer is responsible for maintaining the availability and delivery of the Infrastructure within the IT function. This is delivered as part of a 24/7/365 support model underpinning the delivery of all associated services and service levels in line with contractual performance levels.

Job Description


Please Note this role is a 12 Month FTC with the option to Work From Home.
Support the operation of IT Infrastructure from the VMWare virtualisation layer up through the Windows operating system and associated applications and tools
ensuring they are patched in line with support and security requirements
ensuring they are monitored and managed to meet required performance and capacity levels
ensuring they are resilient and available to underpin the business defined uptime SLAs
as a 3rd line specialist, support the diagnosis and resolution of complex technical issues escalated via 2nd line support or directly through analysis of the system performance and behaviour
Develop existing and new services to meet business requirements
Propose and develop continuous improvement plans for existing services
Support the development of operational roadmaps for existing services
Work closely with other key staff, including the Infrastructure Architect, on the development of new services.
Support the testing and operational acceptance of new services and service changes ensuring that tests are developed and implemented to allow effective service delivery
Engage with the immediate team, and more widely as required, on Knowledge Transfer and training activities to reduce risk of individual members of staff being single points of failure
On-call duty to ensure 24/7 critical cover for IT Infrastructure
Support and implement the IT development and service management processes, as required, including Incident, Change, Release, Problem and Capacity and Availability Management
Comply with other corporate policies and processes as defined
Support the IT Technical Support Manager with Vendor and Supplier technical performance and management reviews
Act as an external ambassador, representing and promoting UKMS to customers and suppliers through all relevant contact
Support the production of reports relating to the IT Technical Support team and service performance.

Basic Requirements


Person - Profile:

Core Competencies:
Able to demonstrate the key cultural principles of the Technical Support Office in terms of Collaboration with others, Achieving Service Targets and driving Continuous Improvement
Self-driven, results-oriented with a positive outlook, keen for new experiences and responsibilities with a clear focus on high quality and operational efficiency.
A natural forward planner who critically assesses own performance and is proactive and self-driven in achieving goals and objectives.
Mature, credible, a team player and comfortable in dealing with key stakeholders of the role. i.e. Reliable, tolerant, approachable and determined.
Empathetic communicator, able to see things from the other person's point of view.
Technical Expertise:

Academic and Technical Qualifications:
HNC or above in an IT related discipline or substantial relevant experience
ITIL v3 foundation Desirable
Other technical expertise, experience and knowledge
Significant experience in the design, implementation and operation of critical IT infrastructure services in an enterprise environment
Significant experience of developing, deployment and operation of Infrastructure technologies. Key technical skills across 2x posts:
VMWare Virtualisation (ESXi, vCentre, vROPs, SRM)
Windows Server (2008 upwards)
Microsoft technologies including Active Directory, Exchange, Certificate Services, Cluster Services
Automation and Scripting
AntiVirus
Experience of the broader set of infrastructure technologies such as: Enterprise Storage, Backup, Server Hardware, Databases (e.g. MS SQL, Oracle, DB2, MySQL), Linux Server OS, Loadbalancers, Security (CyberArk, RSA etc) - Desirable
Extensive industry experience working in Technical Support teams demonstrating an analytical approach to solving complex problems
Demonstrable ability to identify improvements in Technical Support SLAs e.g. Incident Resolution, Availability Management, Operate and Maintenance etc.
Good understanding of OSS/BSS Applications such as BMC Remedy, HP Openview, Netcool, Comptel/Mediations Systems etc - Desirable

Under 10%

VERTEX PHARMACEUTICALS EUROPE LTD (MILTON PARK)

OPERATIONS POSITION DESCRIPTION

TITLE: Senior Logistics Technician DEPARTMENT: Laboratory Services (Facilities/Operations)

POSITION SUMMARY:

The Senior Lab Logistics Technician is responsible for the receipt and distribution of incoming materials at the Vertex research facility, and for organising outgoing shipments to all UK and International destinations. This includes receiving of purchased goods and distributing chemicals/reagents to lab areas, and managing supplies of lab gases, liquid nitrogen, and dry ice. Additional responsibilities include collection of bio-hazard/solvent waste, regular equipment checks and distribution of daily post and catering deliveries.

The candidate will have previous experience of working in a logistics or stores type role, ideally in a fast-paced pharmaceutical or biotech environment. The role requires a high degree of communication with internal customers and a flexible attitude towards work as priorities change. The Senior Logistics Technician will work closely with members of the wider Laboratory Services and International Operations Teams, will require no day-to-day supervision and has complete responsibility for certain functions unless stated otherwise.

PRINCIPAL ACCOUNTABILITIES:

Supports the Ops Manager in the day-to-day running of the sites Goods-in area.
Co-ordinates the shipping and tracking of goods to UK and overseas destinations, ensuring the correct packaging and documentation is supplied and liaises with shipping companies and recipients to quickly resolve issues.
Ensure that materials with special handling, storage or distribution requirements (such as hazardous shipments and temperature sensitive material) are properly monitored
Receives all incoming purchased goods and post, checks for accuracy against packing slips and logs/verifies on the electronic receiving system (Oracle)
Raises and records queries with vendors on faulty or incorrect goods.
Ensures that all receipt and invoice queries are resolved with Purchasing and Accounting.
Manages receipt, stock control and weekly checks for all gas cylinders, liquid nitrogen and dry ice supplies.
Replenishes laboratory solvent stocks and removes empty solvent bottles from laboratories for recycling.
Responsible for the collection of bio-hazard, chemical, radioactive, and solvent waste from laboratories, liaising with the waste contractor to arrange additional collections when required.
Responsible for weekly filling of liquid nitrogen cryo-banks.
Responsible for raising purchase orders and checking invoices for shipping/goods-in/waste management processes.
Ensures all SOPs for areas of responsibility are maintained and reflect current practice.
Keeping monthly shipping/receipt metrics up to date.
Potential for carrying out inventory checks and placing orders to replenish lab consumable stocks via the appropriate purchasing platform.
Responds to and resolves on-line help desk requests across areas of responsibility.
Supports wider Facilities tasks/duties as directed by the Ops Manager.

Ability to occasionally cover the duties of the Laboratory Technician if required (glass washing, sterilisation, stock management, laundry collection etc).

TECHNICAL AND COMMUNICATIVE SKILLS:

Exhibits responsible ability to work independently and effectively in a fast-paced environment.
Friendly and professional demeanor with excellent communication skills to assist customers, lab personal and internal/external stakeholders.
Displays excellent self-organisation, multi-tasking skills and ability to prioritise tasks.
Demonstrates good accuracy level in recording activities and diligent in filing of receipts and waste documentation.
Strict compliance with safety policy and confidence to report any deviation from protocols
Competency with MS word and ability to use the electronic receiving database (Oracle).
Team player and flexible attitude towards work.

QUALIFICATION & EXPERIENCE:

Exhibits responsible ability to work independently and efficiently
Ability to work under time pressures and flexible to meet changing business requirements
Possesses excellent technical competency with the electronic receiving database
Displays excellent self-organising, multi-tasking skills and ability to prioritise tasks
Demonstrates good accuracy level in all recording activities and is very diligent in filing receipts and regulatory documentation
Excellent communication skills with delivery personnel and customers, and confidence to report any operational/safety deviation from set protocols by the site personnel
Possesses good technical competency with electronic finance databases e.g. Oracle. Has experience or the ability to gain an understanding of general laboratory practice and safety regulations in laboratory areas
Demonstrates good attention to detail in all activities, particularly those with EHS responsibilities.
Confidence to report any observed operational/safety deviation from set protocols.
Supervision of personnel

The IT Shared Service Centre was established in 2008 and is designed to deliver centralised IT infrastructure and services to ABF companies. We currently operate in 23 countries over 185 locations, with over 150 employees.

The role of the Service Desk Analyst will be to enable an effective IT support service by acting as a single point of contact for all IT issues and queries. Involves taking initial contacts from the SSC customer base and ensuring through a process of triage whether to resolve at contact or assign for resolution.

The role is based at the ABF IT Shared Service Centre in Peterborough and involves maintaining a high standard of communication and customer service through various contact channels.

Service Desk Analyst Responsibilities:
Act as a single point of contact for all IT issues and queries.
Receive and log all customer contacts via multiple channels (phone, email, chat, self-service).
Use probing questions and defined knowledge information to accurately log the details of the customers enquiry.
Troubleshoot tickets and make accurate decisions on the right path for resolution of the customer enquiry i.e. concluding as a First Time Fix or assigning to 2nd or 3rd party resolution teams.
Use appropriate technology and technical knowledge to enable the accurate and timely diagnosis of issues.
Where appropriate use personalised decisions and actions to add value by resolving the customer’s enquiry at the point of contact.
Ensure all relevant information is clearly recorded in the ITSM tool.
Provide timely and accurate updates to tickets.
Where required ensure the timely escalation of complaints to the appropriate level.
Continuously maintain a high standard of customer service.
Create and publish support documentation and knowledge information and support the Team Leader in training of new staff.
Alert the line management to identify trends in customer issues or queries.
Completion of ad-hoc tasks assigned by Management.
Service Desk Analyst Requirements:

Essential;
Experience of delivering excellent customer service.
General understanding of PC architecture.
Excellent written and oral communication skills.
Excellent interpersonal skills.
Ability to take a logical approach to fault finding and problem resolution.
Desirable:
Intermediate understanding of Microsoft Productivity tools (Office, Lync etc).
One year of Service Desk experience.
ITIL foundation or experience of working in an ITIL environment.
Experience with desktop and server operating systems.
Basic network and server troubleshooting skills.
Intermediate PC troubleshooting skills.

Salary: £Competitive

You may have experience of the following: IT Service Desk Analyst, Technical Support Analyst, System Support Analyst, IT Support, 1st Line Support, Technical Support, Support Analyst, Network Support, Helpdesk Analyst, Desktop Support, Help Desk, IT Support Technician, ITIL, Active Directory, etc.

We have an opening for an enthusiastic and customer focused Technical Support Analyst to join our growing technical team.

£25-34k per annum + car and benefits

The successful candidate will have at least 5 year’s commercial IT support experience, with excellent knowledge of Microsoft operating systems and applications, server and desktop hardware, cloud technologies (online backup/DR/email) and a good understanding of networking.

Microsoft qualifications are highly desirable and would be an advantage. This is an excellent position for the right candidate wishing to pursue an IT career with a growing company. The role is 50% field based and 50% in-house at our new offices in Swindon.

Job Description:

Responsibilities:

Provide 2nd/3rd line support on desktop infrastructure and Microsoft Servers
Setup, deployment, update and maintenance of Windows based systems.
Create and maintain IT related documentation for all systems
Managing and maintaining virtualized environments (mainly Hyper-V)
Monitoring, support, and maintenance of core servers and services
Backups and disaster recovery systems
Network infrastructure (both on site and inter site – e.g. VPN, Firewall and Routers)
Project delivery and implementation of hardware/software related projects
Be available for out-of-hours support via the on-call rota, very attractive rates
Requirements:

A minimum of 5 years’ experience in technical support / client management role
Previous experience in both end-user and infrastructure IT support activities essential
Excellent knowledge of Microsoft Windows Server including virtualisation to MCSA level
Excellent knowledge of Network technologies (IP, Switching, Routing, Internet, VPN, MPLS)
Good understanding of security solutions (McAfee, Symantec)
Experience of managing and supporting cloud based solutions (backup/DR/email)
Proven background in delivering projects and consultancy to clients as their trusted advisor
Ability to work in high pressure environments individually and as part of a team.

Smart appearance
Able to communicate technical information clearly and effectively
Strong communication skills
A team player
Company minded
Flexible approach to working hours due to demanding business environment

Job Description:
Date issued: September 2018

Location:
Syn-Star Complete I.T. Solutions – London Road, Rake, Petersfield Hampshire GU33 7JH

What we’re looking for:
An enthusiastic and motivated IT server technician to take full responsibility for the management of incoming support requests. The successful candidate, who will have at least two years practical experience working on an I.T. support help desk. They will be able to work independently and part of a team, be people focused and be a creative problem solver.

Key Responsibilities:

• Manage and support SME clients I.T. hardware and network
• Attend to call outs to companies and individuals within the Hampshire area (pool cars)
• Provide remote and telephone-based support
• Build rapport with existing and potential clients
• Provide first class technical support to client accounts at all times
• Ability to keep up to date with new technology and knowledge share within the team
• Enjoy helping others with varying technical abilities

The Ideal Candidate:

• Ideally 2 years’ plus experience within the I.T support industry
• Previous experience in varied I.T Support and client accounts
• Working knowledge of Microsoft Server 2003 to date, (Mac and Citrix preferred but not essential)
• Ability to work productively within a team of 8
• Being forward thinking and innovative
• Ability to build working relationships with clients
• Must be able to drive to attend to call outs – Company pool car provided
• Embrace responsibility of being a key holder

required immediately to join our growing team based in St Ives, Cambs.

Salary range £18k to £22k

The successful applicant will have a genuine enthusiasm for all things IT related. He / she will be able to embrace the challenge of supporting a number of small and medium sized businesses with varied IT requirements, typically within 25 miles of St Ives, Cambs. Good communication skills, both verbal and written are essential as well as being able to work alone and as part of a team.

The role's main responsibilities will include:-:
Visiting customers to provide support, as well as install and maintain IT equipment.
Providing technical support via telephone and use of remote control software.
Investigating hardware, software and malware issues.
Updating the service records and support ticketing systems.
Maintaining accurate documentation records.
Installing, configuring and management of Windows and Apple based networks.
Support of all current versions MS Office.
Management of Outlook and mobile email services on mobile devices and tablets.
The ideal IT Support Technician will possess the following skills and experience:-
Microsoft based server & desktop operating systems and software to A+ standard or better.
Apple Mac experience.
Clean UK driving licence and appropriate car.
Networking and firewalls, Group Policy, Exchange Server, Active Directory.
Service desk software, RMM.
Minimum 4+ years in industry.
Planning, admin, verbal and written communication skills.
Wide knowledge of computing principles independent of vendor specific technology.
Practical knowledge of a range of hardware including servers, workstations, printers and mobile devices.
How to Apply:-

If you meet the criteria above and have the relevant experience, apply today!

We will consider each application for this position on its merits. We accept that some of the most gifted technical individuals do not enter this industry via formal academic paths. If you believe you have the skills and /or experience but lack the qualifications, tell us why you would thrive in this IT Support Technician role.

Along with your CV please tell us what you would expect from an employer and what we can expect from you. To be considered for the role, you must have the right to live and work in the UK.

Here is your chance to be part of the team that makes Warwick University’s Estates Department one of the most enjoyable places to work in the Coventry area.

The Estates Office looks after the Warwick University campus - the land it's built on and the buildings it's made up of. Estates mission is “Making and caring for inspiring spaces & providing an outstanding service.” We have a set of values which we expect all employees to work to and embody as excellent representatives of our department:

• Professionalism
• Ownership
• Respect
• Teamwork

The Mechanical Services Section is responsible to the operations and maintenance of a wide variety of complex equipment throughout the University Estate. The Building Services Technician's operate a two shift twelve hour rota system that covers 365 days a year. Their duties involve attending breakdowns, conducting planned maintenance and the monitoring of heating and ventilation plant, hot and cold water systems and a wide range of associated electrical services.

The Building Services Technician role is to provide an effective and efficient business critical responsive service for all mechanical/electrical building services installed throughout the University including heating/ventilation, air conditioning, and gas fired plant, BMS controls, power supplies, lighting systems and motors. This service is 24/7 and deals in the first instance with all emergencies and breakdowns across the Campus.

You will be responsible for assisting in the supervision of contractors, the implementation of escalation procedures to maintain business continuity and to provide the first point of contact in emergency situations.

You should be able to prioritise own workload and tasks, taking into account where the problem is, the nature of the problem, the number of people affected and the usage of the building.

To prioritise the workload of Assistant Building Services Technicians and provide direct supervision of their daily duties.

The implementation of the escalation procedures for business critical services, i.e. fire alarm faults, server room breakdowns and lift failures.

We provide excellent working conditions, generous annual leave, uniform, pension scheme, childcare vouchers and use of the University's leisure and cultural facilities.
Job Description
JOB PURPOSE

To operate, repair and maintain the full range of building service equipment and services across the University Campus, to ensure efficient and effective, continuous operation of all spaces including Teaching, Research, Commercial and Residential areas.

Responsible for assisting in the supervision of contractors, the implementation of escalation procedures to maintain business continuity and to provide the first point of contact in emergency situations.

DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES
To prioritise own workload and tasks, taking into account where the problem is, the nature of the problem, the number of people affected and the usage of the building.
To prioritise the workload of Assistant Building Services Technicians and provide direct supervision of their daily duties.
The implementation of the escalation procedures for business critical services, i.e. fire alarm faults, server room breakdowns and lift failures.
To record resolutions and feedback to problems to work instructions, complete timesheets, service records and other work related paperwork in priority order.
The arranging of access to equipment, in/out of normal working hours, including any required downtime.
The ordering of materials for planned preventive maintenance work and maintaining stock levels of emergency spares.
Management of specialist contracts.
In accordance with all University policies and guidance assist the Maintenance Contracts Officer with the management of contractors ensuring that work is undertaken to the University accepted standards and demonstrates value for money.
Liaise with contractors and explain technical faults so that the contractor can evaluate a repair solution and take over the work in a safe and timely manner.
Ensure compliance with health and safety regulations by issuing and monitoring of permits to work.
Accept the handover of completed works back from contractor’s ensuring that all relevant certification, service records and reports are received in accordance with contract service level agreements.
Provide regular feedback to the customer on the status of any repairs, review any actions taken and monitor repairs to ensure business continuity.
Technical
To provide an effective and efficient business critical responsive service for all mechanical/electrical building services installed throughout the University including heating/ventilation, air conditioning, and gas fired plant, BMS controls, power supplies, lighting systems and motors. This service is 24/7 and deals in the first instance with all emergencies and breakdowns across the Campus. This includes with little or no notice;
• Initial discussion with Department system owner on apparent fault.
• Making a preliminary diagnosis of the fault by interrogating computerised or examine mechanical systems to interpret why the fault occurred and by comparing systems with original specifications, drawings and maintenance manuals.
• Take initial corrective action to keep the service going and ensure business continuity. Report findings and resolution to Line Manager during normal hours and to the Help Desk answer machine out of normal hours.
• Making final repair to equipment and prove a successful repair
• To review any actions taken and monitor repair to ensure continued correct operation
• To generate written reports to confirm findings, work completed and any recommendations
To carry out a diverse range of Planned maintenance duties to ensure the efficient and reliable operation of LPHW boiler plant, heating systems, ventilation, air conditioning, refrigeration, lifts and other mechanical and electrical equipment as generated from the computerised docket system on a planned basis.
By individual systems this will include;
• Carrying out plant room inspections to ensure that plant and equipment is running correctly
• Arranging downtime for plant and equipment, in / out of normal hours
• Action work and restore equipment to normal running condition
• Monitor / review any work carried out to ensure no faults have been introduced into the system and provide recommendations for altering frequency of maintenance routines.

Communication
Communicating the status of breakdowns regularly to the customer, including when work is completed.
Liaise with stakeholders and departmental representatives when maintenance activities may have an adverse impact on the building users operations.
Liaise with other members of staff on emergency call out work or with specialist external contractors that have been asked to attend site, acting as a safety person and to provide technical site knowledge.
General
Driving of University vehicles to transport staff, materials and tools around the University Estates.
To undertake any other duties as from time to time maybe required commensurate with the grade of the post.
Other information
The post holder would be the first point of contact for any estates emergencies outside of the normal working hours.
The rota employs a two shift system to cover 24 hours per day on 12 hour shifts; it is likely that there will be one or two post-holders on each shift along with one Assistant Building Services Technician.
Person Specification

The Person Specification focuses on the knowledge, skills, experience and qualifications required to undertake the role effectively. This is measured by (a) Application Form, (b) Test/Exercise, (c) Interview, (d) Presentation.
Essential Criteria 1
NVQ level 3, or equivalent, in electrical/mechanical installation/maintenance or a related building services discipline (a)(c)
Essential Criteria 2
Proven work experience of having worked within the building services sector, undertaking electrical and mechanical installation/maintenance works (a)(c)
Essential Criteria 3
Previous experience of operating Building Management Systems (a)(c)
Essential Criteria 4
A good understanding/knowledge of Health and Safety and operational practices, for example confined spaces, working at height, Asbestos awareness, working with electricity and pressurised gases and liquids (a)(c)
Essential Criteria 5
Excellent organisational skills with the ability to prioritise (a)(c)
Essential Criteria 6
Ability to resolve problems and use own initiative taking ownership of a problem and resolving (a)(c)
Essential Criteria 7
Commitment to customer service and high standards and quality ensuring Business Continuity is at the highest possible level (a)(c)
Essential Criteria 8
Good interpersonal skills and the confidence to enable effective communication with colleagues at all levels/contacts/suppliers external to the University and with members of the general public (a)(c)
Essential Criteria 9
The ability to ensure compliance with Health and Safety requirements for themselves and contractors, both job specific and generally (a)(c)
Essential Criteria 10
Good verbal and written communication skills to enable the post holder to report on actions taken to remedy faults and to help with reading and understanding maintenance manuals (a)(c)
Desirable Criteria 1
Experience of supervising staff and/or contractors (a)(c)
Desirable Criteria 2
Unvented Hot Water / Water Regulations (a)(c)
Desirable Criteria 3
17th Edition qualifications (a)(c)
Further Particulars
1. The post holder would be the first point of contact for any estates emergencies outside of the normal working hours.
The rota employs a two shift system to cover 24 hours per day on 12 hour shifts; it is likely that there will be one or two post-holders on each shift along with one Assistant Building Services Technician.
Liaise and work with other Estates office sections, all other University personnel and students to ensure that duties are carried out with the minimum of disruption.
For further information about the University of Warwick, please read our University Further Particulars.

For further information about the department, please visit the departmental website.

More information is available on the University’s Vacancy pages and applicants may request a copy of the DBS Code of Practice.

Job Title: 1st Line IT Support Technician - e-Learning / Education Tech
Job Description:
Do you have a natural interest within a broad spectrum of IT? Is your tech knowledge up-to-date i.e. you know GSuite is now Google Workplace?

Are you a logical thinker with a huge drive to provide exceptional customer service? If so, we have a great opportunity, where your excellence can help us to transform the lives of others.

We are open to receiving applications from all suitability-skilled candidates. Perhaps you’re an IT Graduate looking to kick-start your career, maybe you’ve retrained in the field of IT or you are a return-to-work parent ready to re-enter the workplace.

Role Info:

1st Line IT Support Technician | E-learning, Assessment, Training Brand
Canterbury, Kent / Adhoc Remote Flexibility + Monthly visits to other company locations in and around London
Salary: £18,500 DOE + Benefits, Bonus & Personal Development
Hours: 37.5 hours per week full-time

Immediate Start Available

About you:

As part of a friendly, proactive support IT team we are looking for a confident, organised, IT orientated individual with proven organisational and IT skills along with a natural flair for attention to detail. The successful applicant’s key tasks and responsibilities include:

+ Support clients with all IT queries.
+ Help colleagues with technical enquiries.
+ Respond to client and inhouse emails and tickets
+ Administration & Support of Video Conferencing Systems
+ Work with various IT systems including a customer relationship management database keeping accurate records and tasks up to date
+ 1st line Web Administration
+ Assist with administrative duties based on business needs
+ Provide basic IT training to team members

To succeed in this role you will have an understanding of

+ Desktop IT software & hardware
+ Google Workplace
+ Network Methodology
+ Active Directory
+ HTML / Wordpress
+ Database management

About us:

We are a friendly, dynamic, successful and expanding company providing training courses to teachers and psychologists, e-learning consultancy and educational psychology services.

We innovate by combining expertise in Technology, Psychology and Education to produce online tools and provide world class training to education professionals across the globe. We are investing to accelerate the development of unique tools and services that allow teachers to expand their skills and knowledge to improve the lives of the children they teach.

Our Values:

+ Inclusivity - valuing others, respecting others, recognising and celebrating the contribution of all.
+ Positivity - taking a positive outlook, a positive response to challenges and seeking to overcome adversity.
+ Curiosity - seeking to reflect, learn, ask questions and challenging orthodoxies
+ Integrity - acting fairly, honestly, and consistently.
+ Growth - change is challenging and rewarding. We seek growth for individuals, organisations and the business.

As a company, we value inclusivity, positivity, curiosity, integrity, growth and sustainability. We seek to work with people who share our values to enable us to grow in the Educational Technology sector.
We would like applicants to demonstrate how they share our values when we speak with them.

Benefits:

+ We build our team with talented, positive-thinking and experienced individuals from diverse backgrounds.
+ Working within a friendly, supportive team
+ Competitive salary
+ Annual bonus
+ Holiday and pension
+ Family+ friendly flexible working hours including some home working if desired.
+ Training and professional development opportunities

Service Desk Analyst (6-Month FTC)

The IT Shared Service Centre was established in 2008 and is designed to deliver centralised IT infrastructure and services to ABF companies. We currently operate in 23 countries over 185 locations, with over 150 employees.

The role of the Service Desk Analyst will be to enable an effective IT support service by acting as a single point of contact for all IT issues and queries. Involves taking initial contacts from the SSC customer base and ensuring through a process of triage whether to resolve at contact or assign for resolution.

The role is based at the ABF IT Shared Service Centre in Peterborough and involves maintaining a high standard of communication and customer service through various contact channels.

Service Desk Analyst Responsibilities:
Act as a single point of contact for all IT issues and queries.
Receive and log all customer contacts via multiple channels (phone, email, chat, self-service).
Use probing questions and defined knowledge information to accurately log the details of the customers enquiry.
Troubleshoot tickets and make accurate decisions on the right path for resolution of the customer enquiry i.e. concluding as a First Time Fix or assigning to 2nd or 3rd party resolution teams.
Use appropriate technology and technical knowledge to enable the accurate and timely diagnosis of issues.
Where appropriate use personalised decisions and actions to add value by resolving the customer’s enquiry at the point of contact.
Ensure all relevant information is clearly recorded in the ITSM tool.
Provide timely and accurate updates to tickets.
Where required ensure the timely escalation of complaints to the appropriate level.
Continuously maintain a high standard of customer service.
Create and publish support documentation and knowledge information and support the Team Leader in training of new staff.
Alert the line management to identify trends in customer issues or queries.
Completion of ad-hoc tasks assigned by Management.
Service Desk Analyst Requirements:

Essential;
Experience of delivering excellent customer service.
General understanding of PC architecture.
Excellent written and oral communication skills.
Excellent interpersonal skills.
Ability to take a logical approach to fault finding and problem resolution.
Desirable:
Intermediate understanding of Microsoft Productivity tools (Office, Lync etc).
One year of Service Desk experience.
ITIL foundation or experience of working in an ITIL environment.
Experience with desktop and server operating systems.
Basic network and server troubleshooting skills.
Intermediate PC troubleshooting skills.
About Associated British Foods (ABF Holdings):

Associated British Foods is a diversified international food, ingredients and retail group with sales of £15.6bn, 137,000 employees and operations in 50 countries across Europe, southern Africa, the Americas, Asia and Australia.

Location: Peterborough, Cambridgeshire PE2 6WZ (Remote working available)

Job type: Full Time, 6-month Fixed Term Contract

Salary: £Competitive

You may have experience of the following: IT Service Desk Analyst, Technical Support Analyst, System Support Analyst, IT Support, 1st Line Support, Technical Support, Support Analyst, Network Support, Helpdesk Analyst, Desktop Support, Help Desk, IT Support Technician, ITIL, Active Directory, etc.

Job Title: IT Support Engineer - Experienced and Apprentice
Job Description:
We are a well-established company with over 30 years’ experience in the Workforce Time Management Solutions industry. We provide customers with systems to help them carry out everyday tasks for payroll, timesheets, absence tracking, HR, health & safety fire alarm roll call, access control security, shop floor data collection etc. Hardware devices supplied and supported are face recognition, fingerprint biometrics, hand scanning and proximity RFID.

Due to the continued growth and success of the company, we are currently seeking the right applicant to join our small friendly team at our head office in Hertford.

The helpdesk support is a very varied role and would suit somebody who likes customer support, problem-solving and repairing hardware. The successful candidate will be fully trained on our product range to help assist with installations, setup, commissioning and end-user training.

Excellent opportunities exist for the right person to progress to seeing clients in the field.
Responsibilities and Duties: *
Technical help desk assistance.
Setup & Commissioning of systems.
Remote End User Training.
Liaise with field-based engineers.
Equipment preparation & testing.
There are many other complex duties that the candidate can learn or adapt their current skills.
The Ideal Candidate: *
Should have plenty of energy, enthusiasm, self-motivation and the desire to succeed within a busy progressive technical & sales environment.
Will have good communication skills.
Should have the ability to multi-task.
Will be able to work to tight deadlines.
Preference will be given to candidates with a good background in PC’s, networking, and the ability to apply a positive flexible attitude.
Knowledge of the Time & Attendance & Access industry is not essential, as full training will be provided in-house.
The candidate must have a reasonable level of PC Experience and be willing to learn new software packages.
Clear concise friendly telephone manner, self-disciplined, work on own initiative, team-working skills, accuracy & flexibility.

Monday to Friday

IT Support: 1 year (Preferred)

Job Title: Health Physics Support Technician/ Environmental Technician Supervisor
Job Description:
About the job
Summary
The Chemical, Biological and Radiological Division (CBR) of Dstl provides an integrated Chemistry, Biology, Radiation and Medical Sciences capability, delivering technical services, scientific research, advice and consultancy, and an emergency response capability in support of UK Defence and Security.

Do you have a passion for the environment and working in a variety of locations?

If so, this is an exciting opportunity for an individual keen to apply their knowledge and skills to supervise radiation related survey work. We want to recruit someone with experience in health physics, radiation protection, environmental science or contaminated land to join our Radiation Sciences Group and provide routine survey and monitoring for radiological and workplace hazards to our military and civilian customers.

We offer excellent training and personal development opportunities, which makes this role particularly suited to an individual wishing to broaden their experience and the range of work they undertake.
Job description
We will build on your skills and knowledge to enable you to:
Conduct radiological surveys in land and marine environments to support an ongoing environmental monitoring programme on Ministry of Defence sites. Other work includes monitoring and categorisation of radiological material, building surveys and radiological desk studies.
Technical:
Planning and preparing all aspects of radiological surveys and other health physics work covering safety, technical and quality requirements in collaboration with Project Teams.
Researching and writing summary reports for land quality studies and following surveys.
Maintaining land survey equipment and supplies.
Encouraging the continual improvement of quality, service and technical standards.
Coaching others to develop technical excellence and build resilience.
Supporting wider Group activities to ensure operational efficiency.
Emergency Response:
Following a period of training, the successful candidate will provide on call support to the MOD Nuclear Emergency Monitoring Organisation, participate in exercises as a designated Classified Radiation Worker and Monitoring Controller.
Professional development:
Professional development will include achieving and maintaining Dstl RPA Body appointment as a Health Physics Support Technician.

Responsibilities*We’re looking for someone: *
Who has experience in working in radiation protection.
Able to work collaboratively to plan and embed technical quality and safety into fieldwork.
Capable of undertaking a variety of health physics tasks in various locations.
With the ability to develop colleague’s technical skills to help them work safely and efficiently.
Important Information *
This role will require full UK security clearance and you should have resided in the UK for the past 5 years.

Our work in defence, security and intelligence requires our employees to be British Citizens who are able to gain a high level of security clearance to understand the work you will undertake to protect us from any security threats. For this reason, we regret that only UK Nationals will be able to apply for this role. If you are an international or dual-national candidate, and you think you have the skills we need, please consider applying to any of our government, security or defence partners across the enterprise. We work closely with the Defence and Security Industry on many projects, so it would be great to work with you via one of our partners.
Licences
Full driving license. The role will be based at the Alverstoke site but will regularly require travel to/working at remote customer sites, where public transport may not be available.
Qualifications
City & Guilds Radiation Safety Practice Stage 2 or NVQ equivalent and/or
a related degree or qualification such as environmental, earth or geo sciences.

To apply for this role please follow this link (https://bit.ly/31WdhAx) to Civil Service Jobs where you can find more information and apply online.

Job Introduction
About SCC and ETI

Surrey County Council (SCC) is responsible for several local public services in Surrey. The Environment, Transport and Infrastructure (ETI) directorate within SCC is responsible for a wide range of services including highways, transport, planning, countryside and waste management. These services are critical for people living, working and travelling through Surrey, delivered by the county council or in partnership.

About the Team

We are setting up a new team to carry out the Bridge Inspections throughout the County, you will be part of the team evolving and making this area of the business effective and efficient

The Infrastructure Schemes team within the Network and Asset Management Group comprises of 17 staff who are responsible for influencing and embedding the Highways Asset Strategy as it relates to the management of structures, drainage and VRS assets and translating the Asset Strategy into an annual works programme. The Infrastructure Schemes Team works in collaboration with its private sector delivery partner to design and commission works and is also responsible for planning and carrying out Bridge Inspections.

The team is highly technical and works on a wide range of projects from routine maintenance of structures to highly complex maintenance or replacement of structures, drainage and VRS projects. Maintenance of Structures forms the largest part of the team’s role with responsibility for inspection and maintenance of 1,200 structures as well as involvement with structures owned by other organisations such as Network Rail and Highways England.

About the role

Providing Specialist support for the team carrying out their functions of Delivering the annual Inspection programme you will also be involved in other works in Infrastructure Team, helping the delivery of Routine Maintenance and Capital Projects.

About you

This is an exciting challenge for a individual with strong interpersonal skills in the Highways and Structures sector. To be shortlisted for an interview for this position, your application and supporting statement will clearly evidence:

Experience of working within Highways and Structures Inspection Teams
An ability to work on own and be a good performing team player
Flexibility to work as the job demands

We can offer you:

A healthy work-life balance; Flexible working is supported where possible, including working from home or from one of the hot desking facilities at a number of County Council sites.
A laptop and mobile will be supplied if applicable to your role.
26 days annual leave (rising to 28 after the completion of 2 years’ service)
A generous local government salary-related pension
Option to join our car lease scheme and many more discounted life-style benefits please visit MyBenefits for Surrey County Council staff.

Additional Information
Interested in finding out more?

For more information on this role please review the Job Descriptions attached to the bottom of this advert before applying. For further discussion prior to applying please contact Hiring Manager by email lloyd.allen@surreycc.gov.uk.

How to apply?

Please apply via Surrey County Council's recruitment portal by completing a questionnaire, uploading your CV and a supporting statement outlining how you meet the requirement of this role.

Closing date for applications: 27th November at 23:59.

Interview: Week commencing 7th December (via video link) or at Merrow Depot Guildford GU4 7BQ.

Surrey County Council is committed to safeguarding and promoting the welfare of children, young people and vulnerable adults and expects all staff and volunteers to share this commitment. We want to be an inclusive and diverse employer of first choice reflecting the community we serve and particularly welcome applications from all under represented groups.

Company Information
Our Values

Our values are what support our vision, shape the culture and are crucial in delivering our corporate strategy.

Package Description
Do you have an interest in pursuing a career within engineering? If yes, then this is a great opportunity to build your career with an organisation which will train and invest in you.

Surrey County Council is committed to the development of its workforce and as such this role is also available to applicants who already work for Surrey County Council.

Our IT strategy is a service lead approach rather than the traditional technology focussed approach. IT is a service to the business, and as with any service it is there to provide value to its customers. IT’s role is to assist/enable my client in achieving its business objectives and priorities.

This is a key role within the IT team, as the Service Engineer is the member most visible to the rest of the business, and responsible for day to day onsite support, with ad hoc requirements to get involved in IT service projects. Job Title: Experienced 1st line IT Support Engineer - TK
Job Description:
Experienced 1st Line Support Technician from 18-24k depending on experience
Northampton

We are seeking to recruit a highly motivated professional with a background of providing IT telephone/remote and in-person support using Service Desk methodology and software.

Largely based at our head office in Northampton, you will be working within a dedicated team to assist the IT Service Delivery Manager in the continued maintenance and smooth running of our client's infrastructure, break/fix support, proactive support and new equipment installations.

The successful candidate will report into the IT Service Delivery Manager and will be involved in the operational resolution of incidents, problems, events, requests, the maintenance of the IT systems/infrastructure and its security.

Excellent knowledge and experience of working with previous and current versions of Microsoft Office, Microsoft Desktop and Microsoft Server operating & email systems with AD integration, including building, configuration and fault resolution
